prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: ??? → Akbey Hicks
Description: The victim. Was seated in First Class like myself, but I don't know his name.
Character 1
Name: Rhoda Teneiro
Description: A GoYou Airlines flight attendant charged with taking care of First Class.
Character 2
Name: Zinc Lablanc
Description: From N. European Republic of Borginia. Says he's a wealthy art dealer. Time-obsessed.
Character 3
Name: Cammy Meele
Description: A GoYou Airlines flight attendant charged with taking care of First Class.
Character 4
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. Prosecutor at age 13. Lives in Germany.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Travel Wallet
Description: Picked up off the floor in front of the elevator. It isn't mine, so whose is it...? Picked up off the floor in front of the elevator. There is but a passport inside. [info] Stained by grape juice and nothing else.
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Body found at 6:15 AM inside the elevator stopped at the first floor lounge. Body found at 6:15 AM inside elevator on 1st floor. Was hit on the back of his head. [caption] The victim slumps against the elevator wall. There is a string for a badge around his neck but the badge is missing. Money and cards are scattered on the floor. There is a statue shaped like a racoon, too.
Evidence 3
Name: Sky Magazine
Description: Details meals, movies, and other services inside.
Evidence 4
Name: Photo of Mr. Hicks
Description: Found in the victim's pocket. A souvenir picture, perhaps? Found in the victim's pocket. This was taken at a museum in Europe.
Evidence 5
Name: Missing Cell Phone → Mr. Hicks's Cell Phone
Description: The victim supposedly had one, but it has gone missing. Did the killer take it? The killer took this from the victim. It was found in Rhoda Teneiro's personal locker, The killer took this from the victim. There are pictures stored on this.
Evidence 6
Name: Captain Ugo Piggy Bank
Description: Usually on display at the in-flight shop. Found at the crime scene with blood on it. Found at the crime scene. Culprit must've shattered the display case to take it. This was taken out of its display case in the in-flight shop after the turbulence.
Evidence 7
Name: Grape Juice Footprints
Description: Spilt during the turbulence. Looks like footprints and something being dragged. [info] The footprints lead from within the elevator out into the lounge.
Evidence 8
Name: Refueling in Zheng Fa → Cargo from Zheng Fa
Description: Made a brief stop from 4 AM to 5 AM to transfer cargo and refuel at transfer point. It was loaded onboard during the refueling between 4 and 5 AM at the transfer point.
Evidence 9
Name: Ms. Meele's Testimony
Description: "Mr. Akbey Hicks was there in his seat when we took off again at 5 AM."
Evidence 10
Name: GoYou Suitcase
Description: This was used to transport the body. It was designed by Ms. Rhoda Teneiro. The Bloody Cloth was found inside. Highly likely killer got this from the cargo hold.
Evidence 11
Name: Bloody Cloth → Borginian Cloth
Description: Found inside the suitcase, its beautiful pattern has been soiled by blood. World-famous export of Borginia, its beautiful pattern has been soiled by blood.
Evidence 12
Name: Suitcase Receipt
Description: Bought at the in-flight shop and left in attendants' room. The timestamp says 5:40 AM.
Evidence 13
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: Instantaneous death resulting from blow to back of head. Bruising: head to mid back.
Evidence 14
Name: Alif Red Certificate
Description: Document written in Borginian. Proof the statue was loaded onboard in Europe. Document in Borginian. Says statue was loaded onboard in Europe, but statue is a fake.
Evidence 15
Name: Alif Red Statue
Description: Piece of art being shipped by Mr. Lablanc who claims it is worth 10 million cents. Fake piece being shipped by Mr. Lablanc. It was smuggled onboard in Zheng Fa.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I swear to tell the whole truth as a professional flight attendant.
Person: Teneiro
Testimony 1
Testimony: Unfortunately for you, Mr. Edgeworth, I am certain you are the killer.
Person: Teneiro
Testimony 2
Testimony: The scene I saw in front of the elevator...
Person: Teneiro
Testimony 3
Testimony: ...it was you, standing there, with fresh blood dripping off of the murder weapon.
Person: Teneiro
Testimony 4
Testimony: So, if you would please cooperate, we'll turn you over just as soon as we land.
Person: Teneiro

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 9 (Ms. Meele's Testimony) states: "Mr. Akbey Hicks was there in his seat when we took off again at 5 AM."

Evidence 8 (Refueling in Zheng Fa) states that the plane made a transfer and refueled between 4 AM to 5 AM at the transfer point, during which cargo was loaded, including the fake statue.

Testimony 3 (Teneiro): "...it was you, standing there, with fresh blood dripping off of the murder weapon."

The contradiction arises concerning the timing and presence of Mr. Hicks. According to Ms. Meele (Evidence 9), Hicks was alive and in his seat at 5 AM, yet the refueling and cargo loading from 4 to 5 AM (Evidence 8) indicates the statue was smuggled onboard during that time, implying the murder (which took place in the elevator around 6:15 AM according to Evidence 2) happened after. Teneiro's accusation of "fresh blood dripping" might point to a time when Hicks shouldn't have been alive or present according to other evidence. 

However, the most direct and clear contradiction is between Evidence 9 (Ms. Meele's testimony about Hicks being alive at 5 AM) and Testimony 3 (Teneiro's statement accusing Edgeworth of being at the scene with fresh blood), because Teneiro implies Edgeworth was at the scene of the crime with the murder weapon, which could conflict with evidence about timing and presence.

But the user request is one pair: evidence and testimony that contradict each other.

The strongest direct contradiction is:

Evidence 9 and Testimony 3 — Ms. Meele confirms Hicks alive at 5 AM, but Teneiro claims the user (Edgeworth), was at the crime scene with fresh blood (implying being at the crime scene after murder), which conflicts with the user's known presence or timing.

So the best pair is evidence 9 and testimony 3.

(I suppose turbulence is to be expected on a flight. Though admittedly, I'm less than comfortable with anything resembling earthquakes... Hm? What's this...? A travel wallet? But it's not mine... How did someone else's travel wallet wind up in my pocket...? Nnngh...! My head... Why won't this headache go away...? I'll take care of this travel wallet later. Or hand it off to an attendant...) Unngh... From earthquake-like turbulence to an elevator... ............ Hmph. What am I doing hesitating like this? (Actually, I know full well why I hesitate. It was when I was still but a young child... I was caught up in a murder that happened in an elevator. But how long am I going to let my past haunt me!? It's just an elevator! I'm a grown man now! I need to behave like one!) Wh......What the...!? What in the world happened!?
???:

Therefore, Evidence 9 and Testimony 0 (or Testimony 1) contradict each other.

cot:
Evidence 9 ("Ms. Meele's Testimony"): "Mr. Akbey Hicks was there in his seat when we took off again at 5 AM." indicates that the victim was alive and in his seat at 5 AM.

Evidence 2 ("Crime Scene Notes") and 13 ("Autopsy Report") indicate that the body was found at 6:15 AM inside the elevator, showing the victim was killed at some point after 5 AM.

Testimony 3 by Franziska: "...the only person in this lounge the entire time was you, Miles Edgeworth!" suggests that Mr. Edgeworth was the only person in the lounge from when the victim was last seen to when the body was found.

This testimony conflicts with Ms. Meele's testimony that the victim was seen alive at 5 AM in First Class and with other evidence implying the timeline includes others besides Edgeworth being present (such as the attacker moving the body from the elevator).

Thus, the contradiction lies between the evidence that places the victim alive at 5 AM in First Class (Evidence 9: Ms. Meele's Testimony) and Franziska's Testimony 3 that claims only Edgeworth was in the lounge during that entire period.

However, the question asks for one pair of evidence and testimony.

Another contradiction is between Evidence 7 ("Grape Juice Footprints") which shows footprints leading from within the elevator out into the lounge, indicating that the body (or something related) was moved from the elevator into the lounge, whereas Testimony 1 by Franziska ("The scene of the crime was here, in the very lounge the body was discovered.") implies the crime happened in the lounge, but the body was found in the elevator (Evidence 2).

This suggests the crime happened at the elevator (Evidence 2), contradicting Franziska's claim.

Therefore, the pair to point out is Evidence 2 (Crime Scene Notes) and Testimony 1 (Franziska's claim about the scene of the crime being in the lounge).

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 9 (Ms. Meele's Testimony) states: "Mr. Akbey Hicks was there in his seat when we took off again at 5 AM."

Testimony 1 (Franziska) states: "And then, you waited for the victim in the lounge, where you beat him to death."

The murder happened in the lounge according to Testimony 1. However, Evidence 9 asserts the victim was in his seat at 5 AM, implying he was not in the lounge at that time. If the murder took place before 5 AM in the lounge, Ms. Meele's statement would be false. Both statements cannot be true simultaneously.
